question: In 1993 Swedish car manufacturer Saab experimented with replacing the steering wheel with a joystick in a Saab 9000.
It was once believed that injecting shark cartilage into people would prevent them from contracting cancer.
Throughout the entirety of "Dragon Ball Z", Goku only kills two characters: a miniboss named Yakon and Kid Buu.
The names of Roxas's Keyblades in Kingdom Hearts are "Oathkeeper" and "Oblivion".
The value of one Calorie is different than the value of one calorie.
During the Winter War, the amount of Soviet Union soliders that died or went missing was five times more than Finland's.
George Clinton, Vice President of the United States (1805-1812), is an ancestor of President Bill Clinton.

The Statue of Liberty's official name is “Liberty Enlightening the World”.
